name: Use of Incorrect Operator
description: The product accidentally uses the wrong operator, which changes the logic in security-relevant ways.

x_mitre_detection_methods.description: This weakness can be found easily using static analysis. However in some cases an operator might appear to be incorrect, but is actually correct and reflects unusual logic within the program.
This weakness can be found easily using static analysis. However in some cases an operator might appear to be incorrect, but is actually correct and reflects unusual logic within the program.

x_mitre_observed_examples.description: Chain: data visualization program written in PHP uses the "!=" operator instead of the type-strict "!==" operator (CWE-480) when validating hash values, potentially leading to an incorrect type conversion (CWE-704)

Chain: Python-based HTTP Proxy server uses the wrong boolean operators (CWE-480) causing an  incorrect comparison (CWE-697) that identifies an authN failure if all three conditions are met instead of only one, allowing bypass of the proxy authentication (CWE-1390)
